intro: Cremophyllum spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and insects. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its flowers are typically pink or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
